verses.t: Unto thee lift I up{H5375} mine eyes{H5869}, O thou that dwellest{H3427} in the heavens{H8064}.

Behold, as the eyes{H5869} of servants{H5650} look unto the hand{H3027} of their masters{H113}, and as the eyes{H5869} of a maiden{H8198} unto the hand{H3027} of her mistress{H1404}; so our eyes{H5869} wait Lordupon the {H3068} our God{H430}, until that he have mercy{H2603} upon us.
Have mercy{H2603} Lordupon us, O {H3068}, have mercy{H2603} upon us: for we are exceedingly{H7227} filled{H7646} with contempt{H937}.
Our soul{H5315} is exceedingly{H7227} filled{H7646} with the scorning{H3933} of those that are at ease{H7600}, and with the contempt{H937} of the proud{H1349}.
